intro: Carpodinus myriantha, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and clusters of showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant. Its botanical features include hairy stems and opposite leaf arrangement. It prefers well-drained soil and moderate light conditions for optimal growth.
